measurableElement.name: Emergency drug trays are maintained at every point of care, where ever it may be needed
The departments have adequate consumables at point of use
The departments have availability of adequate drugs at point of use
Departments have adequate space as per patient or work load
Departments have layout and demarcated areas as per functions
The facility has adequate circulation area and open spaces according to need and local law
The facility has infrastructure for intramural and extramural communication
The facility and departments are planned to ensure structure follows the function/processes (Structure commensurate with the function of the hospital)
Service counters are available as per patient load
Patient amenities are provide as per patient load
Critical areas of the facility ensures availability of oxygen, medical gases and vacuum supply
The facility has adequate arrangement storage and supply for potable water in all functional areas
The facility ensures adequate power backup in all patient care areas as per load
The facility has security system in place at patient care areas
Patient care areas are clean and hygienic
The facility provides adequate illumination level at patient care areas
Exterior of the facility building is maintained with landscaping in open area
The facility has provision of restriction of visitors in patient areas
The facility has policy of removal of condemned junk material
The facility has established procedures for pest, rodent and animal control
The facility has established measure for safety and security of female staff
The facility ensures safe and comfortable environment for patients and service providers
Patient care areas are clean and hygienic
Hospital infrastructure is adequately maintained
The facility has adequate sets of linen
Hospital has standard procedures for preparation, handling, storage and distribution of diets, as per requirement of patients
The facility has provision of nutritional assessment of the patients
The facility provides diets according to nutritional requirements of the patients
The facility has established procedures for changing of linen in patient care areas
The facility has standard procedures for handling , collection, transportation and washing of linen
Updated copies of relevant laws, regulations and government orders are available at the facility
The facility has requisite licences and certificates for operation of hospital and different activities
The facility ensure relevant processes are in compliance with statutory requirement
There is a system of periodic review of quality of out sourced services
There is established system for contract management for out sourced services
There is a procedure for periodically replenishing the drugs in patient care areas
There is process for storage of vaccines and other drugs, requiring controlled temperature
The facility has establish procedure for procurement of drugs
The facility has established procedure for inventory management techniques
There is a procedure for secure storage of narcotic and psychotropic drugs
The facility ensures management of expiry and near expiry drugs
The facility ensures proper storage of drugs and consumables
There is established procedure for forecasting and indenting drugs and consumables
The facility ensures proper planning and requisition of resources based on its need
The facility ensures the proper utilization of fund provided to it
The facility ensures the adherence to dress code as mandated by its administration / the health department
The facility has established job description as per govt guidelines
The facility has a established procedure for duty roster and deputation to different departments
The facility has established procedures for community based monitoring of its services
The facility has established procedures for management of activities of Rogi Kalyan Samitis
The facility has established procedure for internal and external calibration of measuring Equipment
Operating and maintenance instructions are available with the users of equipment
The facility has established system for maintenance of critical Equipment

Management of children presenting
with fever, cough/ breathlessness is done as per guidelines
The facility provides immunization services as per guidelines

Management of Low birth weight
new-born's is done as per guidelines
Management of children with Severe Acute Malnutrition is done as per guidelines

Triage, Assessment & Management of new-borns having 
emergency signs are done as per guidelines

Management of children presenting with
diarrhoea is done per guidelines
Management of neonatal asphyxia, jaundice and sepsis is done as per guidelines
Facility provides appropriate referral linkages to the patients/Services for transfer to other/higher facilities to assure their continuity of care.
Facility has established procedure for continuity of care during interdepartmental transfer
Facility provides limiting method of family planning as per guideline
Facility provide abortion services for 2nd trimester as per guideline
Facility provide abortion services for 1st trimester as per guideline
Family planning counselling services provided as per guidelines
Facility provide counselling services for abortion as per guideline
Facility provides spacing method of family planning as per guideline
Facility Provides Curative ARSH Services
Facility provides Referral Services for ARSH
Facility provides Preventive ARSH Services
Facility provides Promotive ARSH Services
There is process for identifying and cautious administration of high alert drugs
Medication orders are written legibly and adequately
There is a procedure to check drug before administration/ dispensing
There is a system to ensure right medicine is given to right patient
Patient is counselled for self drug administration
Facility has established procedures for Preoperative care
Facility has established procedures OT Scheduling
Facility has established procedures for Surgical Safety
Facility has established procedures for Post operative care
There is established procedure for follow-up/ reassessment of Patients
There is established procedure for initial assessment of patients
The facility identifies vulnerable patients and ensure their safe care
The facility identifies high risk patients and ensure their care, as per their need
The facility has standard procedures for handling the death in the hospital
Death of admitted patient is adequately recorded and communicated
The facility has standard procedures for referring for post-mortem, its recording and meeting its obligation under the law
The facility has standard operating procedure for end of life support
There is an established procedure for identification of High risk pregnancies and appropriate treatment/referral as per scope of services.
Counselling of pregnant women is done as per standard protocol and gestational age
Facility ensures availability of diagnostic and drugs during antenatal care of pregnant women
There is an established procedure for History taking, Physical examination, and counselling for each antenatal visit.
There is an established procedure for Registration and follow up of pregnant women.
There is an established procedure for identification and management of moderate and severe anaemia
Facility provides service under National Vector Borne Disease Control Program as per guidelines
Facility provides service under National AIDS Control program as per guidelines
Facility provides service under National Leprosy Eradication Program as per guidelines
Facility provides service under National Programme for Prevention and Control of cancer, diabetes, cardiovascular diseases & stroke (NPCDCS) as per guidelines
Facility provides service under National programme for the health care of the elderly as per guidelines
Facility provide service for Integrated disease surveillance program
Facility provides service under Revised National TB Control Program as per guidelines
Facility provide services under National program for prevention and control of deafness
Facility provides service under Mental Health Program as per guidelines
Facility has established procedures for monitoring during anaesthesia
The facility has established procedures for Pre-anaesthetic Check up and maintenance of records
Facility has established procedures for Post Anaesthesia care
Nursing records are maintained
There is established procedure of patient hand over, whenever staff duty change happens
There is procedure for periodic monitoring of patients
Procedure for ensuring timely and accurate nursing care as per treatment plan is established at the facility
Procedure for identification of patients is established at the facility
There is procedure for handling medico legal cases
There is procedure for Receiving and triage of patients
Emergency protocols are defined and implemented
The facility ensures adequate and timely availability of ambulances services and mobilisation of resources, as per requirement
The facility has disaster management plan in place
The facility has established procedure for registration of patients
There is established procedure for managing patients, in case beds are not available at the facility
The facility has a established procedure for OPD consultation
There is established procedure for admission of patients
Procedures performed are written on patients records
Adequate form and formats are available at point of use
All the assessments, re-assessment and investigations are recorded and updated
Register/records are maintained as per guidelines
All treatment plan prescription/orders are recorded in the patient records.
Care provided to each patient is recorded in the patient records
The facility ensures safe and adequate storage and retrieval of medical records
There is established procedure for management/Referral of Obstetrics Emergencies as per scope of services.
There is an established procedure for assisted and C-section deliveries per scope of services.
There is an established procedure for new born resuscitation and new-born care.
Established procedures and standard protocols for management of different stages of labour including AMTSL (Active Management of third Stage of labour) are followed at the facility
Case summary and follow-up instructions are provided at the discharge
The facility has established procedure for patients leaving the facility against medical advice, absconding, etc.
Counselling services are provided as during discharges wherever required
Discharge is done after assessing patient readiness
There are established procedures for Pre-testing Activities
There are established procedures for Post-testing Activities
There are established procedures for testing Activities
There is established procedure for storage of blood
There is established procedure for the Cross matching of blood
There is established procedure for transfusion of blood
There is established procedure for Transport of blood from parent blood bank.
There is a established procedure for monitoring and reporting Transfusion complication
There is established procedure for issuing blood
There is an established procedure for Post partum counselling of mother
There is established procedure for discharge and follow up of mother and new-born.
The facility ensures adequate stay of mother and new-born in a safe environment as per standard Protocols.
Post partum Care is provided to the mothers
The facility has established procedures for stabilization/treatment/referral of post natal complications
There is procedure of rational use of drugs
Facility ensured that drugs are prescribed in generic name only
Facility ensures standard practices and materials for disinfection and sterilization of instruments and equipment
Facility ensures standard practices and materials for decontamination and cleaning of instruments and procedures areas
Facility ensures segregation infectious patients
Facility ensures standard practices followed for cleaning and disinfection of patient care areas
Layout of the department is conducive for the infection control practices
The facility ensures air quality of high risk area
Facility ensures availability of standard materials for cleaning and disinfection of patient care areas
Facility has defined and established antibiotic policy
The facility measures hospital associated infection rates
There is Provision of Periodic Medical Check-up's and immunization of staff
Facility has established procedures for regular monitoring of infection control practices
The facility has provision for Passive and active culture surveillance of critical & high risk areas
Facility has functional infection control committee
Staff is adhere to standard personal protection practices
Facility ensures adequate personal protection equipment as per requirements
Facility ensures management of sharps as per guidelines
Facility Ensures segregation of Bio Medical Waste as per guidelines
Facility ensures transportation and disposal of waste as per guidelines
Staff is trained and adhere to standard hand washing practices
Facility ensures standard practices and materials for antisepsis
Hand washing facilities are provided at point of use
Facility has established internal quality assurance program at relevant departments
Facility has established external assurance programs at relevant departments
Facility has established system for use of check lists in different departments and services
Facility uses tools for quality improvement in services
Facility uses method for quality improvement in services
The facility has a quality team in place
The facility reviews quality of its services at periodic intervals
The facility conducts periodic internal assessment
Corrective and preventive actions are taken to address issues, observed in the assessment & audit
The facility ensures non compliances are enumerated and recorded adequately
The facility conducts the periodic prescription/ medical/death audits
Action plan is made on the gaps found in the assessment / audit process
Progress towards quality objectives is monitored periodically
The facility defines its quality policy
Quality policy and objectives are disseminated and staff is aware of that
The facility periodically defines its quality objectives and key departments have their own objectives
Standard Operating Procedures adequately describes process and procedures
Departmental standard operating procedures are available
Work instructions are displayed at Point of use
Staff is trained and aware of the standard procedures written in SOPs
Patient Satisfaction surveys are conducted at periodic intervals
Facility analyses the patient feed back and do root cause analysis
Facility prepares the action plans for the areas, contributing to low satisfaction of patients.
Facility measures efficiency Indicators on monthly basis
Facility measures Service Quality Indicators on monthly basis
Facility measures Clinical Care & Safety Indicators on monthly basis
Facility measures productivity Indicators on monthly basis
